description.narrative: The impacts of climate change pose significant risks to the financial sector. The overall objective of the Programme is to promote net zero and climate-resilient financial systems that ultimately will support the private sector in deploying climate-related and environmentally sustainable investments. The focus is on supporting central banks and supervisors to better account for climate related risks and make use of the regulatory measures available to them to support a shift of overall financial flows. To achieve its objectives, the programme will also support financial intermediaries in the implementation of these measures, so that they would not only catalyse funding for green projects, but also assess, monitor and report on the climate and environmental impact of such interventions. The Programme contributes to and is aligned with the objectives of the NDC Partnership and its initiative “Readiness support for greening central banks”.
